{"step_by_step_thinking": "Induction agents are medications used to induce anesthesia. They are typically administered intravenously or inhaled. The purpose of induction agents is to rapidly induce unconsciousness and allow for the smooth transition to general anesthesia. Thiopental, also known as thiormtal, is a barbiturate that is commonly used as an induction agent. Halothane is an inhalation anesthetic that can also be used for induction. Nitrous oxide is a commonly used inhalation anesthetic, but it is not typically used as an induction agent. Propofol is a commonly used intravenous induction agent. Based on this information, the correct answer is C. Nitrous oxide.", "answer_choice": "C"}
